TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract SynonymInfo

Docs.summary: Represents the information about synonyms, antonyms, related words, or related expressions for the specified range or a given string.

remarks.para: Use the SynonymInfo property of a or object to return a SynonymInfo object. The SynonymInfo object can be returned either from a range or from Microsoft Word. If it's returned from Word, you specify the lookup word or phrase and a proofing language ID. If it's returned from a range, Word uses the specified range as the lookup word.

Many of the properties of the SynonymInfo object return an Object that contains an array of strings. When working with these properties, you can assign the returned array to a variable and then index the variable to see the elements in the array.
You can check the value of the property to prevent potential errors in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public object AntonymList { get; }
.property instance object AntonymList
Public ReadOnly Property AntonymList As Object
public: property System::Object ^ AntonymList { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a list of antonyms for the word or phrase. The list is returned as an array of strings.

remarks.para: The AntonymList property is a property of the object, which can be returned from either a range or the application. If this object is returned from the application, you specify the word to look up and the language to use. When the object is returned from a range, the range is looked up using the language of the range.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Application Application { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Application Application
Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Application ^ Application { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Application ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Creator { get; }
.property instance int32 Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Found { get; }
.property instance bool Found
Public ReadOnly Property Found As Boolean
public: property bool Found { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if the thesaurus finds synonyms, antonyms, related words, or related expressions for the word or phrase.

MemberSignature.Value: public int MeaningCount { get; }
.property instance int32 MeaningCount
Public ReadOnly Property MeaningCount As Integer
public: property int MeaningCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the number of entries in the list of meanings found in the thesaurus for the word or phrase. Returns 0 (zero) if no meanings were found.

remarks.para: Each meaning represents a unique list of synonyms for the word or phrase.
The lists of related words, related expressions, and antonyms aren't counted as entries in the list of meanings.

MemberSignature.Value: public object MeaningList { get; }
.property instance object MeaningList
Public ReadOnly Property MeaningList As Object
public: property System::Object ^ MeaningList { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the list of meanings for the word or phrase. The list is returned as an array of strings.

remarks.para: The lists of related words, related expressions, and antonyms aren't counted as entries in the list of meanings.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Parent { get; }
.property instance object Parent
Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public object PartOfSpeechList { get; }
.property instance object PartOfSpeechList
Public ReadOnly Property PartOfSpeechList As Object
public: property System::Object ^ PartOfSpeechList { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a list of the parts of speech corresponding to the meanings found for the word or phrase looked up in the thesaurus. The list is returned as an array of integers.

remarks.para: The list of the parts of speech is returned as an array consisting of the following constants: wdAdjective, wdAdverb, wdConjunction, wdIdiom, wdInterjection, wdNoun, wdOther, wdPreposition, wdPronoun, and wdVerb. The array elements are ordered to correspond to the elements returned by the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public object RelatedExpressionList { get; }
.property instance object RelatedExpressionList
Public ReadOnly Property RelatedExpressionList As Object
public: property System::Object ^ RelatedExpressionList { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a list of expressions related to the specified word or phrase. The list is returned as an array of strings.

remarks.para: Typically, there are very few related expressions found in the thesaurus.

MemberSignature.Value: public object RelatedWordList { get; }
.property instance object RelatedWordList
Public ReadOnly Property RelatedWordList As Object
public: property System::Object ^ RelatedWordList { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a list of words related to the specified word or phrase. The list is returned as an array of strings.

MemberSignature.Value: public object SynonymList[ref object Meaning] { get; }
.property instance object SynonymList(object)
Public ReadOnly Property SynonymList(ByRef Meaning As Object) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ SynonymList[System::Object ^ %] { System::Object ^ get(System::Object ^ % Meaning); };

Docs.param: Required Object. The meaning as a string or an index number in the array of possible meanings.
Docs.summary: Returns a list of synonyms for a specified meaning of a word or phrase. The list is returned as an array of strings.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Word { get; }
.property instance string Word
Public ReadOnly Property Word As String
public: property System::String ^ Word { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the word or phrase that was looked up by the thesaurus.

remarks.para: The thesaurus will sometimes look up a shortened version of the string or range used to return the object. The Word property allows you to see the exact string that was used.
